extendedIngredients.name: brussels sprouts
extendedIngredients.original: 1 1/2 pounds Brussels sprouts, ends trimmed and yellow leaves removed
extendedIngredients.originalName: Brussels sprouts, ends trimmed and yellow leaves removed

title: Roasted Brussels Sprouts
summary: Need a caveman, gluten free, primal, and whole 30 side dish? Roasted Brussels Sprouts could be an awesome recipe to try. For 84 cents per serving, this recipe covers 15% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. One portion of this dish contains approximately 4g of protein, 7g of fat, and a total of 111 calories. This recipe serves 6. This recipe from Allrecipes has 1 fans. It can be enjoyed any time, but it is especially good for Christmas. Head to the store and pick up olive oil, brussels sprouts, kosher salt, and a few other things to make it today. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 1 hour. Overall, this recipe earns an amazing spoonacular score of 85%. If you like this recipe, you might also like recipes such as Kittencal's Roasted Brussels/Brussels Sprouts, Cheesy Fried Polenta w/Pan Roasted Balsamic Brussels Sprouts + Roasted Garlic Sage Oil, and Roasted Brussels Sprouts.
instructions: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (205 degrees C).                            Place trimmed Brussels sprouts, olive oil, kosher salt, and pepper in a large resealable plastic bag. Seal tightly, and shake to coat. Pour onto a baking sheet, and place on center oven rack.                            Roast in the preheated oven for 30 to 45 minutes, shaking pan every 5 to 7 minutes for even browning. Reduce heat when necessary to prevent burning. Brussels sprouts should be darkest brown, almost black, when done. Adjust seasoning with kosher salt, if necessary. Serve immediately.                                                Kitchen-Friendly View

steps.step: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (205 degrees C).
Place trimmed Brussels sprouts, olive oil, kosher salt, and pepper in a large resealable plastic bag. Seal tightly, and shake to coat.
Pour onto a baking sheet, and place on center oven rack.

Roast in the preheated oven for 30 to 45 minutes, shaking pan every 5 to 7 minutes for even browning. Reduce heat when necessary to prevent burning. Brussels sprouts should be darkest brown, almost black, when done. Adjust seasoning with kosher salt, if necessary.
